Hello

I have added https://web53.sslblindado.com/criarinfor/criarlondres2012/tamoyo3/ext/wfmcrs01_ext_consulta.aspx as an authorised URL to the ticket checker.

However it's not yet appearing even though I published it a couple of hours ago.

Is there something with this URL which doesn't work? Or is the publishing not working?

Grateful for your thoughts.

Morag

Jamie

Hi Morag,
It appeared to start working at about 6:30. Did someone else intervene to
fix this? (Or did you, perhaps do something to fix it?) If not then I
wonder whether the publication engine was busy earlier this evening?
Although ... even if it was busy it shouldn't be "couple-of-hours" busy.
Will check, based on your responses to the above.
Have a nice weekend!
Kieran

Oh, Jamie fixed it - as often it was inputter error (me, in this case!)

Have a fab weekend!

Hi Wahome, I've investigated, and I think that the answer to the following question will help us (or GDP) resolve this. Could you fwd to GDP (or advise me of our contact there please?)
Thanks, Kieran.

This search:

  http://locog-events.gdp-events.com/controller.ws?method=search&radius=5&startDate=28%2F10%2F2011&endDate=31%2F12%2F2012&pageNo=41

returns (among others) the following title:
  <Title id="9000962627">...</Title>
  
However, we haven't seen title 9000962627 in the feed that we retrieve from you (for example, the most recent LOCOG_FESTIVAL_20120202.xml).

It would be very useful - from our perspective - to discover whether:
 1. Title 9000962627 is erroneously included in the search controller results.
 2. Title 9000962627 has been erroneously excluded from the feed file that we collect.
 3. Something else is going wrong.

Thanks, in advance,

Kieran
Kieran, the main contact at GDP is: Zeeshan.Ghalib@globaldatapoint.com. I'll forward now.
Wahome, no need to contact GDP. We understand the problem now and are just working on a fix.
Good to hear - let me know if I could more helpful.
Done.

Hi all, 

The Greenwich Park team have given us an idea of which content they require to remain live on their site next year, and we anticipate that the content will need updating/editing during Games time. 

Would it be possible to see about making this site content manageable so we can make amends easily in the cms, rather than updating the html?

Thanks very much, 

Antonia
Antonia, this shouldn't be a problem, but can you give us more information about which content is needed for games time?

Hi Danny, 

I'll be able to let you know what is required exactly after I've had a meeting with the GP team next week. They are due a site refresh and one of their team is working on it at the moment so I'l give you a shout as soon as I know. 

Thank you

Hi Danny, 

Had a chat with the GP team and they said to assume that all existing content will bew needed for games time. I'm not sure if that helps you or not?! 

Thanks

Antonia

That's helpful

Just to clarify, we are talking about http://www.london2012.com/greenwich-park/

It could certainly be made content manageable.

The steps are more or less as follows:
- Identify the content requirements (which I think you have just done)
- adapt or amend the existing page layouts as required (assuming no redesign required)
- identify a new address (probably a sub-domain of london2012)
- identify a server for hosting the site
- agree a timetable
- setup a new CMS instance
- construct templates
- add content
- launch site

That's it for now.

This support ticket has been automatically closed.

For support assistance please contact support@kitsite.com
For general information concerning Kitsite or PostCMS  please contact info@kitsite.com

thanks

Kitsite

I think we discussed this briefly last year but there is a requirement to modify the Ceremonies sign-up form phase 2 (i.e. the audition allocation form) to go into Paralympic mode (Paralympic auditions are quite separate from Olympic auditions) next week.
Most of this involves change to text in the supporting pages, but there are also some changes to the text and one field in the form itself. subject: Switching Ceremonies form to Paralympic Auditions - changes required on Tues, 10 Jan
description:
I think we discussed this briefly last year but there is a requirement to modify the Ceremonies sign-up form phase 2 (i.e. the audition allocation form) to go into Paralympic mode (Paralympic auditions are quite separate from Olympic auditions) next week.
Most of this involves change to text in the supporting pages, but there are also some changes to the text and one field in the form itself. The form changes are shown on the attached doc: it's the addition of one new field, plus tweaks to the values in Performance skills (some new values, some removed values). I'm hoping these are not huge. You will
The date for go-live is Weds 11 January, but obviously we are still using the phase 1 form for Olympic auditions until the end of Monday. That means these changes would be required to be made and pushed live on Tues, 10 Jan.  Is that possible?
The process is:

*         Olympic auditions form closes Monday evening. Application Stage II form is moved offline to a new URL .  The old URL /games/ceremonies/get-involved/ceremonies-application-stage-two.php shows a static "Thank you but Olympic auditions are now closed" page.

*         Tuesday - make changes to form as indicated, and change campaign ID (new value tba by Campbell). Test to ensure our system and Campbell's system still talk to each other.

*         Weds - stage 2 form opens with minor changes at a new URL. I suggest / games/ceremonies/get-involved/paralympic-ceremonies-application-stage-two.php
Some time in February (tba) -  stage II form taken offline and replaced with Static pages
Is that okay? Please let me know if you have questions or if this fills your hearts with dread...
Thank you!

Morag

Kieran, I have been looking at this and I don't quite get where the data are coming from:

Here's a search page: http://festival.london2012.com/events/search.php?categoryIds=&searchString=alan+ayckbourn

And here is what I think is the same results set: http://locog-events.gdp-events.com/controller.ws?method=search&searchString=alan+ayckbourn&startDate=28%2F10%2F2011

It looks like the "FROM: ... TO:..." text is being generated by a php method: dateRange2()

But I don't quite get where dateRange2() is getting its information from.
Chris, it looks like the dates in the data feed from the events database are inaccurate. You will need to login and update the records that we use to populate the website.

[cid:image001.png@01CCDB88.78944580]

There is a "performace description" field which I think has been updated (I can see a change to the performance description on http://festival.london2012.com/events/9000961842), but there are also start-date and end-date fields, which are used in the search results page.

Hi Danny

The start and end dates are the ones I’ve amended and this is still showing in the search after a few hours. I haven’t altered the description but I don’t think this affects how the dates are displayed as it’s just free text?

Chris

comments.value:
Russ, we are proposing to write a command-line tool that we will install on all the london2012.com servers which will give diagnostic feedback on whether various web pages and services are running as expected.

The diagnostics are likely to include search services from Global Datapoint, Kitsite and (eventually) Earthware.

It may also include emdedded content from google, chartbeat, twofour, ecommera, stamen, edialog, and other services as required (although these are delivered client-side, so the information we can provide here is more limited).

Running the diagnostics would allow you to identify whether the unavailability of a site is due to the failure of one or more of the web servers or not; wether php or javascript code is failing on any one of a number of designated pages; whether response times are impaired in any way; and whether there are issues with connecting to any of the search services (or other APIs).

We think it's about a week's work to implement, test and deploy.
To be run as a process on staging that runs every few mins and generates a page of diagnostics. Summary to Russ tomorrow, so he can raise a PO.

Additional requests:
- rsync - modification time of rsync log file (is there one?)
- apache - modification time of apache log file
- CMS publishing to staging - time of last publishing event (not sure the easiest way of doing that)

5 days total, including work already completed.

Interestingly, Russ has also asked for this in an XML format, because they want all their suppliers to run diagnostics into an application which they haven't yet built. They don't of course have a spec for the XML yet, let alone the application. This looks like a job we could pitch for if we were interested (although the support requirements don't bear thinking about--do we get called when an XML feed from delta tre fails at 3am in the middle of August?).
Marking as solved. It's here: http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/healthcheck/
